intro: Lagenophora hirsuta var. gracilis, commonly known as the slender hairy lagenophora, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
